   19: %%
   20: -module(trace_call_memory_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: 
   24: %% Test server callbacks
   25: -export([
   26:     suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   27:     init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   28:     init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   29:     init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: %% Test cases exports
   32: -export([
   33:     basic/0, basic/1,
   34:     late_trace/0, late_trace/1,
   35:     skip/0, skip/1,
   36:     message/0, message/1,
   37:     parallel_map/0, parallel_map/1,
   38:     trace_all/0, trace_all/1,
   39:     spawn_memory/0, spawn_memory/1, spawn_memory_internal/1,
   40:     spawn_memory_lambda/1,
   41:     conflict_traces/0, conflict_traces/1,
   42:     big_words/0, big_words/1
   43: ]).
   44: 
   45: suite() ->
   46:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   47: 
   48: all() ->
   49:     trace_sessions:all().
   50: 
   51: groups() ->
   52:     trace_sessions:groups(testcases()).
   53: 
   54: testcases() ->
   55:     [basic, late_trace, skip, message, parallel_map, trace_all, spawn_memory,
   56:     spawn_memory_lambda, conflict_traces, big_words].
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     trace_sessions:init_per_suite(Config).
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   62:     trace_sessions:end_per_suite(Config).
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   65:     trace_sessions:init_per_group(Group, Config).
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   68:     trace_sessions:end_per_group(Group, Config).
   69: 
   70: 
   71: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   72:     trace_sessions:init_per_testcase(Config).
   73: 
   74: end_per_testcase(basic, Config) ->
   75:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   76:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
   77:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   78: end_per_testcase(late_trace, Config) ->
   79:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   80:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   81: end_per_testcase(skip, Config) ->
   82:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   83:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
   84:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   85: end_per_testcase(message, Config) ->
   86:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   87:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
   88:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   89: end_per_testcase(parallel_map, Config) ->
   90:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   91:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
   92:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   93: end_per_testcase(trace_all, Config) ->
   94:     erlang_trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   95:     erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
   96:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
   97: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory, Config) ->
   98:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   99:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  100:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  101: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory_lambda, Config) ->
  102:     erlang_trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, false, [call_memory]),
  103:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  104:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  105: end_per_testcase(conflict_traces, Config) ->
  106:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
  107:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  108:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config);
  109: end_per_testcase(big_words, Config) ->
  110:     erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE,alloc_tuples,2}, false, [call_memory]),
  111:     erlang_trace(self(), false, [call]),
  112:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config).
  113: 
  114: 
  115: erlang_trace(A,B,C) ->
  116:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace(A,B,C).
  117: 
  118: erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C) ->
  119:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C).
  120: 
  121: erlang_trace_info(A,B) ->
  122:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace_info(A,B).
  123: 
  124: 
  125: %% allocation functions
  126: alloc_2tup() ->
  127:     {self(),self()}. %% a non literal
  128: 
  129: receive_message() ->
  130:     receive
  131:         Msg -> Msg
  132:     end.
  133: 
  134: basic() ->
  135:     [{doc, "Assert that two-tuple allocated 3-word structure on the heap"}].
  136: 
  137: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     Self = self(),
  139:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  140:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  141:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  142:     alloc_2tup(),
  143:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  144:     alloc_2tup(),
  145:     {call_memory, [{Self, 2, 6}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  146:     %% test that GC works correctly
  147:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  148:     alloc_2tup(),
  149:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  150:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  151:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  152: 
  153: late_trace() ->
  154:     [{doc, "Tests that garbage_collect call done before tracing is enabled works as expected"}].
  155: 
  156: late_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  157:     Control = self(),
  158:     Pid = spawn_link(
  159:         fun () ->
  160:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  161:             1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  162:             1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call]),
  163:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  164:             Control ! continue,
  165:             receive
  166:                 stop ->
  167:                     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, false, [call_memory])
  168:             end
  169:         end),
  170:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  171:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  172:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  173:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  174:     receive continue -> ok end,
  175:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 12}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, call_memory),
  176:     Pid ! stop,
  177:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end.
  178: 
  179: late_trace_inner() ->
  180:     Ref = alloc_2tup(), %% 3 words
  181:     receive _Msg -> Ref end. %% 9 more words
  182: 
  183: non_literal_9() ->
  184:     %% 9 words in total: 6 words for the list, 3 for the tuple
  185:     erlang:insert_element(2, erlang:insert_element(1, {}, atom), lists:seq(1, 3)).
  186: 
  187: skip() ->
  188:     [{doc, "Tests that skipped trace for a function accumulates in an upper level caller"}].
  189: 
  190: skip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  191:     Self = self(),
  192:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, upper, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  193:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, lower, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  194:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  195:     upper(),
  196:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 8 * 2}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, lower, 1}, call_memory),
  197:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3 + 3 + 6}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, upper, 0}, call_memory).
  198: 
  199: upper() ->
  200:     Ref = alloc_2tup(),          %% 3
  201:     X = middle(Ref),            %% 3 in middle, and 8 in lower (but lower has its own accounting)
  202:     {1, 2, 3, X, Ref}.          %% extra 6 words (5 elements and 1 tuple size)
  203: 
  204: middle(_Ref) ->
  205:     Ref2 = alloc_2tup(),         %% 3 - but accounted in 'upper/0' instead
  206:     lower(8),
  207:     Ref2.
  208: 
  209: lower(Max) ->
  210:     lists:seq(1, Max).
  211: 
  212: message() ->
  213:     [{doc, "Assert that receiving a message results in memory trace"}].
  214: 
  215: message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  216:     Control = self(),
  217:     Traced = {?MODULE, receive_message, 0},
  218:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  219:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  220:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  221:     Pid = spawn_link(
  222:         fun Wrap() ->
  223:             receive
  224:                 pre ->
  225:                     receive_message(),
  226:                     Control ! done,
  227:                     Wrap();
  228:                 stop ->
  229:                     ok
  230:             end
  231:         end),
  232:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  233:     %% first, check that sending a (non-matched) message does not result in a negative allocation
  234:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  235:     timer:sleep(500),
  236:     {call_memory, []} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  237:     %% enter the receive_message/0
  238:     Pid ! pre,
  239:     %% wait for 'done' response
  240:     receive done -> ok end,
  241:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  242:     %% once again, just in case, to verify that decrementing "allocated" worked
  243:     Pid ! pre,
  244:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  245:     receive done -> ok end,
  246:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 2, 18}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  247:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  248: 
  249: parallel_map() ->
  250:     [{doc, "Test memory profiling with spawned processes"}].
  251: 
  252: parallel_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  253:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  254:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_spawn]),
  255:     Pid = spawn_link(fun do_parallel/0),
  256:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  257:     Pid ! pre_stop,
  258:     Pid ! {stop, 1},
  259:     receive
  260:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
  261:             %% alloc_2tup called 3 times (once per process)
  262:             {call_memory, [{_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}]} =
  263:                 erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, call_memory),
  264:             %% receive_message called 8 times (3 from "Allocs", 3 from "Grand", and 2 from the runner)
  265:             %%  from 7 processes, but only 3*6 Grand processes and 3 words for the runner are on the heap
  266:             {call_memory, RecvMsg} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, call_memory),
  267:             {7, 8, 21} = collapse_procs(RecvMsg)
  268:     end.
  269: 
  270: do_parallel() ->
  271:     Allocs = [spawn_link(fun() -> alloc_2tup(), receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  272:     Grand = [spawn_link(fun() -> receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  273:     pre_stop = receive_message(),
  274:     [P ! {atom, <<"1234">>} || P <- Grand], %% 6 words on the heap: 3 for binary, 3 for tuple
  275:     {stop, 1} = receive_message(),
  276:     [exit(P, normal) || P <- Allocs].
  277: 
  278: trace_all() ->
  279:     [{doc, "Enables memory tracing for all processes, mainly ensuring there are no core dumps"}].
  280: 
  281: trace_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  282:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  283:     _ = erlang_trace(all, true, [call]),
  284:     do_heavy_lifting(),
  285:     _ = erlang_trace(all, false, [call]),
  286:     Profile = profile_memory(),
  287:     %% it'd be better to introduce more checks, but for now see that
  288:     %%  at least some action happened
  289:     true = is_map_key(application_controller, Profile).
  290: 
  291: do_heavy_lifting() ->
  292:     {ok, []} = application:ensure_all_started(kernel).
  293: 
  294: profile_memory() ->
  295:     profile_modules(code:all_loaded(), #{}).
  296: 
  297: profile_modules([], Acc) ->
  298:     Acc;
  299: profile_modules([{Module, _} | Tail], Acc) ->
  300:     Funcs = try Module:module_info(functions)
  301:             catch error:undef -> [] % ignore homebrewed without module_info
  302:             end,
  303:     case profile_functions(Module, Funcs, #{}) of
  304:         Empty when Empty =:= #{} ->
  305:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc);
  306:         NonEmpty ->
  307:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc#{Module => NonEmpty})
  308:     end.
  309: 
  310: profile_functions(_Module, [], Acc) ->
  311:     Acc;
  312: profile_functions(Module, [{Fun, Arity} | Tail], Acc) ->
  313:     case erlang_trace_info({Module, Fun, Arity}, call_memory) of
  314:         {call_memory, Skip} when Skip =:= []; Skip =:= false ->
  315:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc);
  316:         {call_memory, Mem} ->
  317:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc#{{Fun, Arity} => collapse_procs(Mem)})
  318:     end.
  319: 
  320: collapse_procs(Processes) ->
  321:     lists:foldl(
  322:         fun ({_Pid, Calls, Words}, {Procs, TotCalls, TotWords}) ->
  323:             {Procs + 1, TotCalls + Calls, TotWords + Words}
  324:         end, {0, 0, 0}, Processes).
  325: 
  326: spawn_memory() ->
  327:     [{doc, "Tests that when a process is spawned, initial memory correctly attributed to the initial call"}].
  328: 
  329: spawn_memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  330:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  331:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  332:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  333:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, [LostSharing]),
  334:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  335:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  336:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [all]),
  337:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn
  338:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 34}]} = erlang_trace_info({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, call_memory).
  339: 
  340: spawn_memory_lambda(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     %% check that tracing with context captured through lambda also works - but reports erlang:apply
  342:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  343:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, true, [call_memory]),
  344:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  345:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(fun () -> spawn_memory_internal(LostSharing) end),
  346:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  347:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  348:     1 = erlang_trace(self(), false, [all]),
  349:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn, and 4 more words for apply itself
  350:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 38}]} = erlang_trace_info({erlang, apply, 2}, call_memory).
  351: 
  352: spawn_memory_internal(Array) ->
  353:     Array.
  354: 
  355: conflict_traces() ->
  356:     [{doc, "Verify that call_time and call_memory don't break each other"}].
  357: 
  358: conflict_traces(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  359:     Self = self(),
  360:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  361:     %% start call_memory trace
  362:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  363:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  364:     alloc_2tup(),
  365:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  366:     %% start/stop call_time trace
  367:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_time]),
  368:     alloc_2tup(), %% this goes to both time and memory
  369:     {call_time, [{Self, 1, _, _}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_time),
  370:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_time]),
  371:     %% memory is unaffected
  372:     alloc_2tup(),
  373:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  374:     %%
  375:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  376:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  377: 
  378: big_words() ->
  379:     [{doc, "Test that Words counter can be a bignum on 32-bit"}].
  380: 
  381: big_words(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     Self = self(),
  383:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_tuples, 2},
  384:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  385:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, true, [call]),
  386:     Words = (1 bsl 27),
  387:     case {erts_debug:size(Words), 8*erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
  388:         {2, 32} -> ok;
  389:         {0, 64} -> ok
  390:     end,
  391:     TupleSz = 1023,
  392:     TupleCnt = Words div (TupleSz + 1),
  393:     alloc_tuples(TupleCnt, TupleSz),
  394:     CallCnt = TupleCnt + 1,
  395:     {call_memory, [{Self, CallCnt, Words}]} = erlang_trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  396:     1 = erlang_trace(Self, false, [call]),
  397:     1 = erlang_trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  398: 
  399: 
  400: alloc_tuples(0, _) ->
  401:     ok;
  402: alloc_tuples(N, TupleSz) ->
  403:     erlang:make_tuple(TupleSz, []),
  404:     alloc_tuples(N-1, TupleSz).
